item.title: Steven add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Distrust all in whom the impulse to punish is powerful." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Steven add a quote by Nietzsche
item.description: "Convictions are more dangerous foes of truth than lies." -- Nietzsche

item.title: Steven add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Chastity—the most unnatural of all the sexual perversions, he added parenthetically, out of [author:Remy de Gourmont|78190]." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Steven add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "I wanted to change the world. But I have found that the only thing one can be sure of changing is oneself." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Steven add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "There is no real direction here, neither lines of power nor cooperation. Decisions are never really made – at best they manage to emerge, from a chaos of peeves, whims, hallucinations and all around assholery. " -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Steven add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "Everybody gets told to write about what they know. The trouble with many of us is that at the earlier stages of life we think we know everything- or to put it more usefully, we are often unaware of the scope and structure of our ignorance." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Steven add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "..., twice two is four is not life, gentlemen, but the beginning of death." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Steven add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Man is tormented by no greater anxiety than to find someone quickly to whom he can hand over that great gift of freedom with which the ill-fated creature is born." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Steven add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "If you wish to glimpse inside a human soul and get to know a man, don't bother analyzing his ways of being silent, of talking, of weeping, of seeing how much he is moved by noble ideas; you will get better results if you just watch him laugh. If he laughs well, he's a good man." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Steven add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Some people never go crazy. What truly horrible lives they must lead." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Steven add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Steven add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Steven add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "When someone shows you who they are believe them; the first time." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Steven add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description:
"I can be changed by what happens to me. But I refuse to be reduced by it.
(Popular misquote of "You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them.")" -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Steven add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "If you expect nothing from anybody, you’re never disappointed." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Steven add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Life is short, Break the Rules. Forgive quickly, Kiss SLOWLY. Love truly. Laugh uncontrollably And never regret ANYTHING That makes you smile." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Steven add a quote by Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
item.description: "You have your way. I have my way. As for the right way, the correct way, and the only way, it does not exist." -- Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

item.title: Steven add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Steven add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Steven add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "It would be possible to describe everything scientifically, but it would make no sense; it would be without meaning, as if you described a Beethoven symphony as a variation of wave pressure." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Steven add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Steven add a quote by Richard P. Feynman
item.description: "Physics is like sex: sure, it may give some practical results, but that's not why we do it." -- Richard P. Feynman
